request_pathways.name: Authorization for Disclosure of Medical Information

forms.document_type: New patient intake packet containing ROI authorization form

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient must download a generic HIPAA authorization form designed for third-party release, print and complete it by hand, then figure out how to submit it with no stated submission instructions.

red_flags: No submission instructions on either form — no address, fax, email, or portal indicated
Witness signature line present with no indication it is optional
Confusing remuneration fill-in fields on a general-purpose authorization form
Phantom page numbering ('PAGE 14 OF 28') on standalone one-page form
Form-2 General Consent Section 11 contains blanket authorization to disclose sensitive records at hospital's discretion
bright_spots: Form-2 distinguishes 'Self or Representative' from 'Other Provider or Facility' with different scope rules
Non-conditioning statement prominently displayed in capitalized text
Psychotherapy notes properly segregated per 45 CFR § 164.508(b)(3)(ii)
42 CFR Part 2 re-disclosure warning correctly included for substance abuse records

findability.rationale: Level 2: Cloudflare Turnstile blocked all direct website access and Google cache; forms retrieved only via Wayback Machine archives, requiring creative search strategies and persistence.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 2: Digitally-created PDF with text layer but zero fillable fields; patient must print, handwrite all entries, and has no documented submission method — a primarily paper workflow.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Logical one-page flow from identification through signature, but dense legal language with 50+ word sentences, no section headers, confusing remuneration fields, and phantom page numbering create notable clarity problems.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: Form-2's authorization distinguishes self-access from third-party release, but both forms are generic HIPAA authorizations not designed for patient self-access; no delivery format options, no date range field, and the better version is buried in a 12-page intake packet.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Proper non-conditioning statement, revocation rights, and 42 CFR Part 2 references, but witness signature line may exceed HIPAA requirements for patient access, no fee disclosure, and no submission pathway stated.

overall.summary: Cottage Hospital provides a minimally functional generic authorization form with proper HIPAA compliance language but significant practical barriers including Cloudflare-blocked website, non-fillable fields, no submission instructions, and no dedicated patient access pathway.
